snifc.sensor
Interface MemoryIfc

public interface MemoryIfc

The memory interface represents the memory of the Sensor. The sensor memory has two behaviors. It can store all new incoming packets, but it can only remember MEMORY_SIZE packet. Every new packet (not in memory) is stored in memory. When it is stored, the oldest packet is removed from memory (so packets are forgotten)

Author:
sfrenot

          The sensor asks the memory to store packet p.

Method Detail

store

public boolean store(PacketIfc p)
The sensor asks the memory to store packet p. If the packet is already in memory the packet is not stored and the method returns false, else the method return true. TODO : the packet should be made younger in the memory stack.

Parameters:
p -
Returns:
false is the packet has not been stored in memory, else otherwise

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
The toString method is called by the simulator to display statistical results of the simulation.
